TopicTitle: The Kerion-Complete Rebuild! Orion MPCV and SLS Replica

Articles.Content:
A replica of NASA's Orion MPCV atop the SLS launcher, property of BluPlanet Incorporated. (I think this should be in spacecraft exchange)

Flight Manual:-Action groups:

backspace: abort, abort, abort

0: toggle 1/2 gimbal

1: eject LES (during flight or after abort)

2: deploy parachutes

Preflight checks:

-Set throttle (as shown below)

-SAS activated

-double-tap 0

Launch

-Go up until 9000 meters (eject SRBs along the way)

-Gradually turn, should be about 45 degrees at 20000 meters

-Reach desired apoapsis (tested at 100 km)

-Fire up stage 2

-Warp until 50 seconds from apoapsis

-circularize

Orbital maneuvers

-The MPCV has plenty of RCS to dock

-It is able to reach munar orbit and return

Note: Kerbal Engineer seen but not included.

Download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/t06aqgighl62mjc/Orion%20MPCV.craft

Edited September 26, 2013 by Kerbol Prime
Note: the term look-alike is used very lightly, since I was going for a design resembling that of the Orion but it didn't end very well...

Oops I just crashed Kerion into my station...time to load the quicksave.

If I may make one suggestion it's to use another decoupler for the launch escape tower because this one remains on the nose of the main craft until you cut power.

Delta-v among the stages is well balanced I think.

I couldn't remember which action-# to press to lock gimbal, so I locked them on both first and second stage. Second stage needs gimbal, easy to enable, else operation went well.
